clinical_study.brief_title: Dual PET/CT Imaging in Lung Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Dual PET/CT Imaging in Lung Cancer (Danish Title: En og Tre Timers FDG-PET/CT Ved Lungecancer)

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to compare conventional PET/CT scan performed 1 hour after injection of the radioactive tracer FDG (PET/CT[1]) with PET/CT performed after 3 hours (PET/CT[3]) in a group of patients with biopsy verified lung cancer or high suspicion of lung cancer after initial work-up (chest x-ray and CT of thorax/upper abdomen), who are potentially operable.

detailed_description.textblock:
The investigators also want to:
- To find the sensitivity, specificity and accuracy in PET/CT 1h and 3 h in the staging of lung cancer (N-/M-stage). Our gold standard is pathology, when not possible - follow-up (se Gold Standard 6.1.1)
- To compare SUVmax with the expression of GLUT1 and G-6-Pase in tumors
- To compare the expression of GLUT1 with the activity of G6Pase
- To compare SUVmax, RI, tumor/liver ratio, GLUT1 and G-6-Pase with the occurrence of relapse within a year after curative surgery

primary_outcome.time_frame: After staging or 1 year of follow up
primary_outcome.description: To find the sensitivity, specificity and accuracy in PET/CT 1h and 3 h in the staging of lung cancer (N-/M-stage). Our gold standard is pathology, when not possible - follow-up

secondary_outcome.description: • To compare SUVmax, RI, tumor/liver ratio, GLUT1 and G-6-Pase with the occurrence of relapse within a year after curative surgery

arm_group.arm_group_label: lung cancer or high suspicion of lung cancer
arm_group.description: After initial work-up (chest x-ray, CT of thorax and upper abdomen, spirometry) found to have surgically resectable lung cancer

intervention.description: Conventional FDG-PET/CT preformed after 1 hour and additional PET/CT 3 hours after injection
intervention.arm_group_label: lung cancer or high suspicion of lung cancer

biospec_descr.textblock: Fresh frozen sample of primary lung cancer tumor

study_pop.textblock: Pt. referred to The Department of Pulmonary Medicine, Odense University Hospital or The Department of Medicine, Hospital of Southern Denmark, Sønderborg with suspicion of lung cancer

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cytologic/histologic-verified lung cancer or high suspicion of lung cancer after initial work up
- Candidate to curative intended surgery after initial work up (usually chest x-ray, CT of chest/upper abdomen and if needed spirometry).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Former lung cancer
- Contraindications for PET/CT: Pregnancy, recent chemoradiotherapy
- Diabetes mellitus.
